intro: Boechera fernaldiana, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Its small, white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and is often found in alpine environments.
